info.title: Xray_REST_API_v2.0
info.description: This OpenAPI specification describes the Xray REST API v2.0 for Xray Server and Data Center (DC).

get.description:
Returns all the steps of a test issue given the key. The response contains for each step the corresponding id, index, fields and the attachments. 

The Test Step fields are identified by their name and can be of type _Data_ (Toggle, Number, Date and Date Time fields), _Option_ (Single Select, Multiple Select and Radio Button fields), _Wiki_ (Native fields, Single and Multiple Line fields). 

The value of step fields of type _Wiki_ have a raw and rendered value. _Option_ fields value will be an array containing the information of the selected options (the option id and its value).

200.description: Successfully retrieved all test steps. Returns an array of step objects, each containing step ID, index position, custom field values (Action, Data, Expected Result, etc.), and associated attachments. Each step includes both raw and rendered values for Wiki-type fields, and option details for select-type custom fields.

post.description:
Creates a new test step. All step fields values are listed under _fields_ and identified by the name and a list of attachments to add to the step. The field values should follow a certain format according to the custom field type. 

- **Toggle Fields** values should be _"true"_, _"false"_, _"0"_ or _"1"_ 

- **Number Fields** values should be a string containing a number, e.g. _"320"_. Decimal Number are also accepted,for instance, "320.5". The decimal places are always separated by a _"."_ 

- **Single Select and Radio Button Fields** values should be a single string containing the option value, e.g. _"Option A"_. The value should be a valid option for that custom field. The values are not case sensitive. 

- **Multiple Select Fields** values should be an array of the string of option values, e.g. _["Option A", "Option B"]_. All the selected values should be valid for that custom field. The option values are not case sensitive. 

- **Date Fields** should follow the ISO format _yyyy-MM-dd_, where _yyyy_ represents the year, _MM_ the month in year and _dd_ the day in the month. For instance, a valid value would be _"2020-05-02"_. 

- **Date Time fields** should be in UTC following the ISO format _yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm'Z'_. The date part follows the same date format, while _HH_ represents the hours (0-24), _mm_ the minutes in hour and _Z_ indicates the hour in UTC. For instance, a valid date time value would be _"2020-05-02T10:30Z"_. 

The remaining field types values do not required a specific validation. For instance, for a Single Line Custom field a valid value would be _"Perform Action B"_. 

If some value is not valid for a certain custom field type, an error will be return stating the field with the incorrect value. Furthermore, **all required step fields must be provided**.

200.description: Test step successfully created. Returns the newly created step object including its unique step ID, assigned index position within the test, populated field values, and any attached files. The response includes validation confirmations for all custom field types and attachment processing status.

parameters.name: testKey
parameters.description: The key of the test issue

get.description:
Returns the values of a single test step, given the test key and the step id. The response follows the same format as the previous endpoints, containing the step id, index, fields and the attachments. 

The Test Step fields are identified by their name and can be of type _Data_ (Toggle, Number, Date and Date Time fields), _Option_ (Single Select, Multiple Select and Radio Button fields), _Wiki_ (Native fields, Single and Multiple Line fields). 

The value of step fields of type _Wiki_ have a raw and rendered value. _Option_ fields value will be an array containing the information of the selected options (the option id and its value).

200.description: Test step details successfully retrieved. Returns the specific test step including its ID, index position, custom field values (Action, Data, Expected Result), and any attached files. Response includes both raw and rendered values for Wiki-type fields and option details for select-type fields.

put.description:
Updates the values of an existing test step, given the test key and step id. The user can update the field values and the attachments of a step. The values should follow a specific format similar to the step creation. 

- **Toggle Fields** values should be _"true"_, _"false"_, _"0"_ or _"1"_ 

- **Number Fields** values should be a string containing a number, e.g. _"320"_. Decimal Number are also accepted,for instance, "320.5". The decimal places are always separated by a _"."_ 

- **Single Select and Radio Button Fields** values should be a single string containing the option value, e.g. _"Option A"_. The value should be a valid option for that custom field. The values are not case sensitive. 

- **Multiple Select Fields** values should be an array of the string of option values, e.g. _["Option A", "Option B"]_. All the selected values should be valid for that custom field. The option values are not case sensitive. 

- **Date Fields** should follow the ISO format _yyyy-MM-dd_, where _yyyy_ represents the year, _MM_ the month in year and _dd_ the day in the month. For instance, a valid value would be _"2020-05-02"_. 

- **Date Time fields** should be in UTC following the ISO format _yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm'Z'_. The date part follows the same date format, while _HH_ represents the hours (0-24), _mm_ the minutes in hour and _Z_ indicates the hour in UTC. For instance, a valid date time value would be _"2020-05-02T10:30Z"_. 

The remaining field types values do not required a specific validation. For instance, for a Single Line Custom field a valid value would be _"Perform Action B"_. 

If some value is not valid for a certain custom field type, an error will be return stating the field with the incorrect value. A field value can be deleted sending an empty value, such as _""_ or _[]_, or by sending _null_. **It is not possible to delete the value of a required field.**

200.description: Test step successfully updated. Returns the updated test step with new field values, updated attachments, and confirmation of all changes applied.

delete.description: Deletes a test step given the test key and the step id.

200.description: Test step successfully deleted. The specified test step has been removed from the test issue and all associated attachments have been cleaned up.

parameters.name: testKey
parameters.description: The key of the test issue

parameters.name: stepId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test step

get.description: Returns all the attachments of a test step, given the test key and step id.

200.description: Test step attachments successfully retrieved. Returns a list of all attachments associated with the specified test step, including attachment IDs, filenames, content types, and metadata.

parameters.name: testKey
parameters.description: The key of the test issue

parameters.name: stepId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test step

delete.description: Deletes a test step attachment, given the test key and step and attachment ids.

200.description: Test step attachment successfully deleted. The specified attachment has been removed from the test step.

parameters.name: testKey
parameters.description: The key of the test issue

parameters.name: stepId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test step

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test step attachment

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about one or more test issues. When keys parameter is provided, returns specific tests; otherwise returns all tests accessible to the user. The response includes test fields, steps, preconditions, and associated metadata.

200.description: Tests successfully exported. Returns detailed information about the specified test issues including their fields, steps, preconditions, and associated metadata.

get.description: Retrieves all test runs associated with a specific test issue. Returns a collection of test runs including execution status, timestamps, assignees, and execution results for the specified test.

200.description: Test runs successfully exported. Returns a collection of test runs for the specified test, including execution status, timestamps, assignees, and results.

parameters.name: testKey
parameters.description: The key of the test issue

get.description: Retrieves all test execution issues that include the specified test. Returns a collection of test executions with their execution details, associated test runs, and execution metadata.

200.description: Test executions successfully exported. Returns a collection of test executions that include the specified test, with execution details and associated test runs.

parameters.name: testKey
parameters.description: The key of the test issue

get.description: Retrieves all test issues associated with a specific precondition. Returns a list of tests that are linked to the precondition, including test details and association metadata.

200.description: Precondition tests successfully retrieved. Returns a list of all test issues associated with the specified precondition, including test details and association metadata.

post.description: Associates or disassociates test issues with a precondition. Supports adding new test associations or removing existing ones through the 'add' and 'remove' operations.

add.description: List of test keys to associate with the precondition

remove.description: List of test keys to disassociate from the precondition

200.description: Test association operation completed successfully. The specified test has been associated with or removed from the precondition as requested.

parameters.name: preconditionKey
parameters.description: The key of the precondition issue

delete.description: Removes the association of the specified test from the given precondition.

parameters.name: preconditionKey
parameters.description: The key of the precondition issue

parameters.name: testKey
parameters.description: The key of the test issue to remove

200.description: Test successfully removed from precondition.

get.description: Retrieves all precondition issues associated with a specific test. Returns a list of preconditions that are linked to the test, providing traceability between tests and their prerequisites.

200.description: Test preconditions successfully exported. Returns a list of all precondition issues associated with the specified test.

parameters.name: testKey
parameters.description: The key of the test issue

get.description: Retrieves all test issues associated with a specific test set. Returns a comprehensive list of tests that belong to the test set, including test details and organizational metadata.

200.description: Test set tests successfully retrieved. Returns a list of all test issues associated with the specified test set.

post.description: Associates or disassociates test issues with a test set. Supports adding new test associations or removing existing ones to manage test set composition and organization.

add.description: List of test keys to associate with the test set

remove.description: List of test keys to disassociate from the test set

200.description: Test set association operation completed successfully. The specified test has been associated with or removed from the test set as requested.

parameters.name: testSetKey
parameters.description: The key of the test set issue

delete.description: Removes the association of the specified test from the given test set.

parameters.name: testSetKey
parameters.description: The key of the test set issue

parameters.name: testKey
parameters.description: The key of the test issue to remove

200.description: Test successfully removed from test set.

404.description: Test set or test not found.

get.description: Retrieves all test set issues that include the specified test. Returns a list of test sets where the test is a member, providing visibility into test organization and grouping.

200.description: Test sets successfully exported. Returns a list of all test set issues that include the specified test.

parameters.name: testKey
parameters.description: The key of the test issue

get.description: Retrieves all test issues associated with a specific test execution. Returns a comprehensive list of tests included in the test execution, along with their current execution status and results.

200.description: Test execution tests successfully retrieved. Returns a list of all test issues associated with the specified test execution, including test details, execution status, and results.

put.description: Associates or disassociates test issues with a test execution. Supports adding new tests to the execution scope or removing tests from the execution plan through 'add' and 'remove' operations.

add.description: List of test keys to associate with the test execution

remove.description: List of test keys to disassociate from the test execution

200.description: Test execution association operation completed successfully. The specified test has been associated with or removed from the test execution as requested.

parameters.name: testExecutionKey
parameters.description: The key of the test execution issue

delete.description: Removes the association of the specified test from the given test execution.

parameters.name: testExecutionKey
parameters.description: The key of the test execution issue

parameters.name: testKey
parameters.description: The key of the test issue to remove

200.description: Test successfully removed from test execution.

404.description: Test execution or test not found.

get.description: Retrieves a Test Run given the Test Execution and Test keys. The response will contain all information related to a Test Run, e.g., status, created and finish dates, step results, test environments, defects, Test Run Custom fields, and so on.

parameters.name: testExecIssueKey
parameters.description: (Required) The key of the Test Execution

parameters.name: testIssueKey
parameters.description: (Required) The key of the Test

200.description: Test Run details successfully retrieved. Returns comprehensive Test Run information including execution status, start/finish timestamps, assignee, test environments, defect associations, step-by-step results with evidence attachments, custom field values, and execution duration metrics.

get.description: Retrieves a Test Run given the Test Run id. The response will contain all information related to a Test Run, e.g., status, created and finish dates, step results, test environments, defects, Test Run Custom fields, and so on.

200.description: Test Run details successfully retrieved. Returns comprehensive Test Run information including execution status (TODO, EXECUTING, PASS, FAIL, ABORTED), start/finish timestamps, assignee, test environments, defect associations, step-by-step results with evidence attachments, custom field values, and execution duration metrics.

put.description:
Updates all the values of a Test Run. The user can update the values of the overall status, step results, assignee, test environments, add defects and evidences and so on. 

To update the value of a Test Run custom field, the id of the field must be provided as well as a valid value for that custom field type. 

- **Toggle Fields** values should be _"true"_, _"false"_, _"0"_ or _"1"_ 

- **Number Fields** values should be a string containing a number, e.g. _"320"_. Decimal Number are also accepted,for instance, "320.5". The decimal places are always separated by a _"."_ 

- **Single Select and Radio Button Fields** values should be a single string containing the option value, e.g. _"Option A"_. The value should be a valid option for that custom field. The values are not case sensitive. 

- **Multiple Select Fields** values should be an array of the string of option values, e.g. _["Option A", "Option B"]_. All the selected values should be valid for that custom field. The option values are not case sensitive. 

- **Date Fields** should follow the ISO format _yyyy-MM-dd_, where _yyyy_ represents the year, _MM_ the month in year and _dd_ the day in the month. For instance, a valid value would be _"2020-05-02"_. 

- **Date Time fields** should be in UTC following the ISO format _yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm'Z'_. The date part follows the same date format, while _HH_ represents the hours (0-24), _mm_ the minutes in hour and _Z_ indicates the hour in UTC. For instance, a valid date time value would be _"2020-05-02T10:30Z"_. 

An error will be returned when there are invalid custom field values.
It is also possible to delete a Test Run custom field value by providing a _null_ or empty value (e.g., _""_ or _[]_). **It is not possible to delete a value of a required Test Run Custom Field value.** Also, **it is not possible to change the Test Run to a final status when there are required Test Run custom fields with empty values.**

200.description: Test Run successfully updated. Returns the updated Test Run with new field values, execution status, evidence attachments, defect associations, and confirmation of all changes applied.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: (Required) The id of the Test Run

get.description: Retrieves the current execution status of a specific Test Run. Returns the status value (TODO, EXECUTING, PASS, FAIL, ABORTED, or custom status) along with related execution metadata.

200.description: Test Run status successfully retrieved. Returns the current execution status value and related execution metadata including timestamps and status history.

put.description: Updates the overall execution status of a specific Test Run. Valid status values include TODO (not started), EXECUTING (in progress), PASS (successful), FAIL (failed), ABORTED (terminated), and any custom statuses configured in Xray. This operation automatically updates finish timestamp for final statuses and triggers status-dependent workflows.

200.description: Test Run status successfully updated. Returns confirmation of the status change with updated timestamp information. The response includes the new status value and any triggered workflow transitions or notifications.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

get.description: Retrieves all defect issues (bugs, issues) associated with a specific Test Run. Returns a comprehensive list of defects linked to the test run, providing traceability between failed test executions and their related issues.

200.description: Test Run defects successfully retrieved. Returns a comprehensive list of all defect issues associated with the Test Run, including defect details, link information, and traceability metadata.

put.description: Associates one or more defect issues (bugs, issues) with a specific Test Run. This creates bidirectional traceability links between failed test executions and their related defects, enabling comprehensive defect tracking and test coverage analysis. Defects can be existing Jira issues or newly created ones.

200.description: Defects successfully linked to Test Run. Returns confirmation of the defect associations created, including the bidirectional traceability links established between the Test Run and the specified defect issues.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

delete.description: Removes the association between a defect issue and a Test Run. This operation breaks the traceability link without affecting the defect issue itself, maintaining clean defect tracking records.

200.description: Defect successfully unlinked from Test Run. The association between the specified defect and Test Run has been removed, while preserving the defect issue itself.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

parameters.name: defectKey
parameters.description: The key of the defect issue

get.description: Retrieves all evidence and attachment files linked to a specific Test Run. Returns a comprehensive list of attachments including file metadata, content types, and attachment identifiers.

200.description: Test Run attachments successfully retrieved. Returns a comprehensive list of all evidence and attachment files linked to the Test Run, including file metadata, content types, and download links.

post.description: Uploads and attaches evidence files to a specific Test Run. Supports multiple file formats and creates permanent evidence links for test execution documentation and proof of testing activities.

200.description: Attachment successfully added to Test Run. Returns confirmation of the evidence upload with attachment metadata including file ID, content type, and storage location.

delete.summary: Delete test run attachment by name
delete.description: Removes a specific attachment from a Test Run by filename. This operation permanently deletes the evidence file and its association with the Test Run.

200.description: Attachment successfully deleted from Test Run. The specified evidence file has been permanently removed from the Test Run and file storage.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

delete.description: Removes a specific attachment from a Test Run by attachment ID. This operation permanently deletes the evidence file and its association with the Test Run.

200.description: Attachment successfully deleted from Test Run. The specified evidence file has been permanently removed from the Test Run and file storage using the attachment ID.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run attachment

get.description: Retrieves the comment associated with a specific Test Run. Returns the textual comment that provides additional context, notes, or observations about the test execution.

200.description: Test Run comment successfully retrieved. Returns the textual comment content associated with the Test Run, providing contextual information about the execution.

put.description: Updates or sets the comment for a specific Test Run. Allows adding contextual information, execution notes, or observations about the test run results and process.

200.description: Test Run comment successfully updated. Returns confirmation that the comment has been set or modified for the Test Run.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

get.description: Retrieves the user assigned to execute a specific Test Run. Returns the assignee information including user details and assignment metadata.

200.description: Test Run assignee successfully retrieved. Returns the user information for the person assigned to execute the Test Run, including user details and assignment metadata.

put.description: Updates the assignee for a specific Test Run. Allows changing the user responsible for executing the test run, supporting workload management and assignment workflows.

assignee.description: The user identifier (username, email, or account ID) to assign to the test run.

200.description: Test run assignee successfully updated. Returns the updated assignee information and confirmation of the assignment change.

404.description: Test run or user not found.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

get.description: Retrieves all step results for a specific Test Run. Returns detailed information about each test step execution including status, evidence, comments, and actual results.

200.description: Test Run steps successfully retrieved. Returns a comprehensive list of all step execution results for the Test Run, including step status, evidence attachments, comments, and detailed execution information.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific test step result within a Test Run. Returns step execution status, evidence attachments, comments, actual results, and execution timing information.

200.description: Test Run step details successfully retrieved. Returns comprehensive information about the specific step execution including status, evidence attachments, comments, actual results, and timing data.

put.description: Updates the execution details of a specific test step within a Test Run. Allows modification of step status, actual results, comments, and evidence attachments.

200.description: Test Run step details successfully updated. Returns confirmation of the step modifications including updated status, actual results, comments, and evidence attachments.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

parameters.name: stepResultId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test step result

get.description: Retrieves the execution status of a specific test step within a Test Run. Returns the current status value (PASS, FAIL, EXECUTING, etc.) and related execution metadata.

200.description: Test Run step status successfully retrieved. Returns the current execution status of the test step with related metadata including timestamps and execution context.

put.description: Updates the execution status of a specific test step within a Test Run. Sets the step result to PASS, FAIL, or other configured status values, automatically updating step execution timestamps.

200.description: Test Run step status successfully updated. Returns confirmation of the status change with updated timestamp information and the new step execution status.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

parameters.name: stepResultId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test step result

get.description: Retrieves all evidence and attachment files linked to a specific test step within a Test Run. Returns step-level evidence including screenshots, logs, and documentation files.

post.description: Uploads and attaches evidence files to a specific test step within a Test Run. Supports step-level evidence documentation such as screenshots, logs, and verification artifacts.

delete.summary: Delete test run step attachment by name
delete.description: Removes a specific attachment from a test step within a Test Run by filename. This operation permanently deletes the step-level evidence file and its association.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

parameters.name: stepResultId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test step result

delete.description: Removes a specific attachment from a test step within a Test Run by attachment ID. This operation permanently deletes the step-level evidence file and its association.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

parameters.name: stepResultId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test step result

parameters.name: stepAttachmentId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test step attachment

get.description: Retrieves the details of a specific outline example for a given test run and example index. Returns example execution data for scenario outline tests including parameter values and results.

put.description: Updates the execution details of a specific outline example for a given test run and example index. Allows modification of example status, results, and parameter values for scenario outline tests.

200.description: Outline example details successfully updated. Returns the updated example details.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

parameters.name: exampleIndex
parameters.description: The index of the outline example (0-based)

get.description: Retrieves a Test Run Custom Field, given the Test Run and the Test Run Custom Field ids.

put.description:
Updates the value of a test run custom field, given the Test Run and the Test Run Custom Field ids. The custom field value should be a valid value according to the field type. 

- **Toggle Fields** values should be _"true"_, _"false"_, _"0"_ or _"1"_ 

- **Number Fields** values should be a string containing a number, e.g. _"320"_. Decimal Number are also accepted,for instance, "320.5". The decimal places are always separated by a _"."_ 

- **Single Select and Radio Button Fields** values should be a single string containing the option value, e.g. _"Option A"_. The value should be a valid option for that custom field. The values are not case sensitive. 

- **Multiple Select Fields** values should be an array of the string of option values, e.g. _["Option A", "Option B"]_. All the selected values should be valid for that custom field. The option values are not case sensitive. 

- **Date Fields** should follow the ISO format _yyyy-MM-dd_, where _yyyy_ represents the year, _MM_ the month in year and _dd_ the day in the month. For instance, a valid value would be _"2020-05-02"_. 

- **Date Time fields** should be in UTC following the ISO format _yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm'Z'_. The date part follows the same date format, while _HH_ represents the hours (0-24), _mm_ the minutes in hour and _Z_ indicates the hour in UTC. For instance, a valid date time value would be _"2020-05-02T10:30Z"_. 

An error will be returned when there are invalid custom field values.
It is also possible to delete a Test Run custom field value by providing a _null_ or empty value (e.g., _""_ or _[]_). **It is not possible to delete a value of a required Test Run Custom Field value.**

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: (Required) The id of the Test Run

parameters.name: customFieldId
parameters.description: (Required) The id of the Test Run Custom Field

get.description: Retrieves all test issues associated with a specific test plan, along with their consolidated execution status across different test executions. Returns comprehensive test information including current status, execution history, and test plan association details.

200.description: Test plan tests successfully retrieved. Returns a comprehensive list of all test issues associated with the test plan, including their consolidated execution status, test details, and execution history across different test executions.

post.description: Associates or disassociates test issues with a test plan. Supports adding new tests to the test plan scope or removing tests from the plan through 'add' and 'remove' operations, enabling dynamic test plan management.

add.description: List of test keys to associate with the test plan

remove.description: List of test keys to disassociate from the test plan

200.description: Test plan association operation completed successfully. The specified test has been associated with or removed from the test plan as requested, updating the test plan scope accordingly.

parameters.name: testPlanKey
parameters.description: The key of the test plan issue

delete.description: Removes the association of the specified test from the given test plan.

parameters.name: testPlanKey
parameters.description: The key of the test plan issue

parameters.name: testKey
parameters.description: The key of the test issue to remove

200.description: Test successfully removed from test plan.

404.description: Test plan or test not found.

get.summary: List test executions in a test plan
get.description: Retrieves all test execution issues associated with a specific test plan. Returns a list of test executions that are linked to the test plan, including execution details and association metadata.

parameters.name: testPlanKey
parameters.description: The key of the test plan issue

200.description: Test executions successfully retrieved. Returns a list of all test executions associated with the specified test plan, including execution details and association metadata.

put.description: Associates or disassociates test execution issues with a test plan. Supports adding new test executions to the plan or removing existing ones through 'add' and 'remove' operations.

parameters.name: testPlanKey
parameters.description: The key of the test plan issue

add.description: List of test execution keys to associate with the test plan.

remove.description: List of test execution keys to disassociate from the test plan.

200.description: Test plan test executions updated successfully. The specified test executions have been associated with or removed from the test plan as requested.

404.description: Test plan or test execution not found.

delete.summary: Remove test execution from test plan
delete.description: Removes the association of the specified test execution from the given test plan.

parameters.name: testPlanKey
parameters.description: The key of the test plan issue

parameters.name: testExecutionKey
parameters.description: The key of the test execution to remove

200.description: Test execution successfully removed from test plan.

404.description: Test plan or test execution not found.

get.description: Retrieves all test plan issues that include the specified test. Returns a list of test plans where the test is a member, providing visibility into test planning and organization across different project contexts.

200.description: Test plans successfully retrieved. Returns a comprehensive list of all test plan issues that include the specified test, with test plan details and association metadata.

parameters.name: testKey
parameters.description: The key of the test issue

get.description: Retrieves the complete folder hierarchy structure of the test repository for a specified project. Returns a tree-like structure showing all folders, subfolders, and their relationships within the test repository, enabling navigation and organization of test assets.

200.description: Successfully retrieved test repository folder hierarchy. Returns a hierarchical tree structure containing folder IDs, names, parent-child relationships, and folder metadata. Each folder node includes its position in the hierarchy and access permissions.

post.description: Creates a new folder in the test repository.

parameters.name: projectKey
parameters.description: The key of the Jira project

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific folder within the test repository. Returns folder metadata including name, path, parent folder, permissions, and contained test assets for the specified folder ID.

put.description: Updates the properties of an existing folder in the test repository. This operation allows changing the folder name and other properties to reorganize the test repository structure. Returns success confirmation after the folder is updated.

delete.description: Removes a folder from the test repository permanently. This operation deletes the specified folder and all its content, including subfolders and test associations. Use with caution as this action cannot be undone. Returns success confirmation after the folder is deleted.

parameters.name: projectKey
parameters.description: The key of the Jira project

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test repository folder

get.description: Retrieves all test issues contained within a specific folder in the test repository. Returns a comprehensive list of tests stored in the folder, including test details, metadata, and organization information. This endpoint enables navigation and management of tests organized in the repository structure.

200.description: Folder tests successfully retrieved. Returns a list of all test issues stored in the specified folder, including test keys, names, and metadata.

put.description: Associates or disassociates test issues with a specific folder in the test repository. Supports adding new tests to the folder or removing existing tests through 'add' and 'remove' operations. This endpoint enables flexible organization and management of tests within the repository structure.

add.description: List of test keys to add to the folder

remove.description: List of test keys to remove from the folder

200.description: Folder tests successfully updated. The specified tests have been associated with or removed from the folder as requested, updating the folder's test organization.

parameters.name: projectKey
parameters.description: The key of the Jira project

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test repository folder

post.description: Imports test execution results using Xray's native JSON format. Creates a new test execution issue or updates an existing one with test run results, including test outcomes, evidence, and execution metadata. Supports bulk import of multiple test results in a single operation.

description.example: This execution is automatically created when importing execution results from an external source

summary.example: Execution of automated tests for release

info.description: This execution is automatically created when importing execution results from an external source
info.summary: Execution of automated tests for release

post.description: Imports Cucumber test execution results from JSON format into Xray. Processes Cucumber feature files execution output including scenarios, scenario outlines, step definitions with Before/After hooks, step execution times, and failure details. Automatically creates or updates Test Executions and Test Runs, matching tests by feature and scenario names.

200.description: Cucumber test execution results successfully imported. Returns import summary containing Test Execution key(s), processing statistics with scenario counts, step execution details, and any validation warnings for unmatched features or scenarios. Includes timing information and hook execution results.

post.description: Imports Behave (Python BDD framework) test execution results from JSON format into Xray. Processes feature files execution output including scenarios, step definitions, execution status, and detailed failure information. Automatically maps Behave features and scenarios to Xray Test issues and creates comprehensive Test Execution reports.

post.description: Imports JUnit test execution results from XML format into Xray. Processes JUnit XML reports including test classes, test methods, execution times, assertions, and failure details with stack traces. Automatically creates or updates Test Executions and Test Runs, matching tests by their fully qualified class and method names. Supports JUnit 4 and 5 XML formats.

200.description: NUnit test execution results successfully imported. Returns import summary with details about created/updated Test Executions, Test Runs, and any parsing warnings or errors. The response includes the Test Execution key(s) created in Xray and statistics about the imported test results.

post.description: Imports NUnit test execution results from XML files into Xray. This endpoint processes NUnit result files and automatically creates or updates Test Executions and Test Runs in Jira. Tests are matched by their fully qualified names, and new Test issues are created if no matching tests exist. Supports NUnit 2.x and 3.x XML formats with detailed test step results, execution times, and failure information.

200.description: NUnit test execution results successfully imported. Returns a JSON object containing the Test Execution key(s) created or updated, import statistics including number of tests processed, execution summary with pass/fail counts, and any warnings about unmatched tests or parsing issues.

get.description: Retrieves all the Test Runs from a given context (paginated). You can obtain Test Runs in one of the following contexts: in a Test Execution issue (optionally filtered by Test issue key), in a Test Plan issue, or in a JQL filter that returns Test Execution issues.

parameters.name: testExecutionKey
parameters.description: The Test Execution issue key.

parameters.name: testKey
parameters.description: The Test issue key (can only be used with testExecutionKey).

parameters.name: testPlanKey
parameters.description: The Test Plan issue key.

parameters.name: includeTestFields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of custom fields of the Test issue to return.

parameters.name: savedFilterId
parameters.description: The Jira JQL filter ID or name containing Test Execution issues.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of Test Runs to return.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of results.

200.description: Returns a JSON array of Test Runs.

post.summary: Import cucumber tests and background from a .feature
post.description: Import cucumber tests and background from a .feature

get.summary: Get custom fields for test steps
get.description: Retrives the configuration of the Test Step custom fields for a project, given the project id. The response contains all information related to the custom fields, such as id, name, description, if the field is require and enable. In the case of optional custom fields (Multiple and Single Select Fields and Radio Buttons), the list of the custom field options is also retrieved.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Jira project

get.summary: Get custom fields for test runs
get.description: Retrives the configuration of the Test Run custom fields for a project, given the project id. The response contains all information related to the custom fields, such as id, name, description, if the field is require and enable, and the test types the custom field is associated with. In the case of optional custom fields (Multiple and Single Select Fields and Radio Buttons), the list of the custom field options is also retrieved.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Jira project

get.summary: Get possible test step statuses from configuration
get.description: Get possible test step statuses from configuration

Retrieves all possible test execution statuses configured in the Xray global settings. Returns both built-in statuses (TODO, EXECUTING, PASS, FAIL, ABORTED) and any custom statuses defined by administrators. This information is essential for validating status transitions and building status-aware integrations.

200.description: Successfully retrieved test status configuration. Returns an array of status objects containing status names, IDs, descriptions, color coding, and transition rules. Includes information about which statuses are considered final states and their hierarchical relationships.

get.summary: Get all iterations for a test run
get.description: Retrieves all iterations associated with a Test Run for data-driven testing scenarios. Each iteration represents a single execution cycle with different test data parameters. Returns iteration details including status, execution results, and parameter values used during each iteration.

200.description: Test Run iterations successfully retrieved. Returns an array of iteration objects, each containing iteration ID, execution status, parameter values, step results, and associated evidence for data-driven test execution analysis.

post.summary: Create a new iteration for a test run
post.description: Creates a new iteration for data-driven Test Run execution. Iterations enable running the same test with different parameter sets, essential for comprehensive data-driven testing workflows. Each iteration maintains independent execution status and results.

parameters.description: Parameter values for this iteration

201.description: Test Run iteration successfully created. Returns the new iteration object with assigned ID, parameter values, and initial execution status ready for test execution.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

get.description: Retrieves detailed information for a specific Test Run iteration including execution status, parameter values, step-by-step results, defects, and evidence attachments. Essential for analyzing individual iteration outcomes in data-driven testing scenarios.

200.description: Test Run iteration details successfully retrieved. Returns comprehensive iteration information including execution status, parameter values used, step results with evidence, defect associations, and execution timing data.

put.description: Updates a specific Test Run iteration with new execution results, status changes, parameter modifications, or additional evidence. Supports updating iteration-level status, step results, and associated metadata for comprehensive iteration management.

parameters.description: Updated parameter values for this iteration

comment.example: All assertions passed with production data

200.description: Test Run iteration successfully updated. Returns the updated iteration with new status, parameter values, step results, and execution metadata.

delete.description: Deletes a specific Test Run iteration and all associated execution data including step results, evidence attachments, and parameter values. Use with caution as this permanently removes iteration execution history.

200.description: Test Run iteration successfully deleted. The specified iteration and all associated execution data have been permanently removed.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

parameters.name: iterationId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the iteration

get.description: Retrieves detailed execution information for a specific step within a Test Run iteration. Returns step-level results including status, actual results, evidence attachments, and parameter substitutions used during iteration execution.

200.description: Iteration step details successfully retrieved. Returns step execution status, actual results, evidence attachments, and parameter values used for this specific step within the iteration.

put.description: Updates execution results for a specific step within a Test Run iteration. Allows updating step status, actual results, evidence, and step-level comments for granular iteration execution tracking.

actualResult.example: User successfully logged in with credentials: testuser1/password123

200.description: Iteration step execution results successfully updated. Returns the updated step with new status, actual results, and evidence attachments.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

parameters.name: iterationId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the iteration

parameters.name: stepId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test step

get.summary: Get all test step results for iteration
get.description: Retrieves all test step results for a specific Test Run iteration. Returns comprehensive step execution data including status, actual results, evidence attachments, and parameter substitutions used during iteration execution.

200.description: Test Run iteration steps successfully retrieved. Returns a comprehensive list of all step execution results for the iteration, including step status, evidence attachments, comments, and detailed execution information.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

parameters.name: iterationId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the iteration

get.description: Retrieves the execution status of a specific test step within a Test Run iteration. Returns the current status value (PASS, FAIL, EXECUTING, etc.) and related execution metadata.

200.description: Iteration step status successfully retrieved. Returns the current execution status of the test step with related metadata including timestamps and execution context.

put.description: Updates the execution status of a specific test step within a Test Run iteration. Allows setting step status with optional comment and timing information for precise iteration execution tracking.

status.description: New execution status for the step

comment.description: Optional comment about the status change

executedOn.description: Timestamp when the step was executed

200.description: Iteration step status successfully updated. Returns the updated status information with timestamps and execution metadata.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test run

parameters.name: iterationId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the iteration

parameters.name: stepId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the test step

get.description: Exports test datasets used for data-driven testing scenarios. Returns dataset definitions including parameter names, data rows, and associated test mappings. Supports multiple export formats for integration with external test automation tools.

parameters.name: datasetId
parameters.description: Specific dataset ID to export

parameters.name: projectKey
parameters.description: Project key to filter datasets

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Export format

200.description: Test datasets successfully exported. Returns dataset definitions with parameter schemas, data rows, and test associations in the requested format for data-driven test automation.

post.description: Imports test datasets for data-driven testing scenarios. Accepts dataset definitions with parameter schemas and data rows. Supports bulk import operations and validation of dataset structures against existing test definitions.

description.example: Test data for user authentication scenarios

file.description: CSV or Excel file containing dataset

201.description: Test datasets successfully imported. Returns created dataset IDs and validation results for imported data structures.

400.description: Invalid dataset format or validation errors in the imported data.

put.summary: Reset test run statuses in bulk
put.description: Resets execution status for multiple Test Runs back to TODO status. Useful for re-executing test suites, clearing previous execution results, or preparing test runs for new execution cycles. Supports filtering by project, test plan, or test execution.

testRunIds.description: Specific test run IDs to reset

testExecutionKey.description: Reset all test runs in a test execution

testPlanKey.description: Reset all test runs in a test plan

projectKey.description: Reset all test runs in a project

200.description: Test Run statuses successfully reset. Returns count of affected test runs and summary of reset operations performed.

put.description: Resets requirement status calculations and coverage metrics for multiple requirements. Useful for recalculating requirement coverage after test modifications, clearing cached status data, or refreshing requirement-test traceability matrices.

projectKey.description: Reset all requirements in a project

200.description: Requirement statuses successfully reset. Returns count of affected requirements and summary of coverage recalculation results.
